DataElement.preferredName: Cerebrospinal Fluid Diagnostic Procedure Opening Pressure Performed Centimeters of water 1 Decimal Place Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The 1 decimal place numeric cm H2O value measured, assigned or computed related to the assessment of cerebrospinal fluid opening pressure in a specimen.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Cerebrospinal Fluid Diagnostic Procedure Opening Pressure Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The fluid that is contained within the brain ventricles, the subarachnoid space and the central canal of the spinal cord._Any procedure or test to diagnose a disease or disorder._The initial pressure of cerebrospinal fluid when sampled via lumbar puncture. It is a surrogate measurement of intracranial pressure._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (seh-REE-broe-SPY-nal) The fluid flowing around the brain and spinal cord. Cerebrospinal fluid is produced in the ventricles in the brain.:Methods, procedures, and tests performed to diagnose disease, disordered function, or disability.

Concepts.definition: The fluid that is contained within the brain ventricles, the subarachnoid space and the central canal of the spinal cord.
Any procedure or test to diagnose a disease or disorder.

Property.preferredName: Opening Pressure at Lumbar Puncture Performed
Property.preferredDefinition: The initial pressure of cerebrospinal fluid when sampled via lumbar puncture. It is a surrogate measurement of intracranial pressure. :Executed and carried through to completion.

Concepts.definition: The initial pressure of cerebrospinal fluid when sampled via lumbar puncture. It is a surrogate measurement of intracranial pressure.
Executed and carried through to completion.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: . 2020-12-16 ak OK to release per WZ.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Centimeters of water 1 Decimal Place Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A unit of pressure defined by a column of water with a height of one centimeter, frequently used to measure central venous pressure, intracranial pressure, and for pressures during mechanical ventilation._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::1_An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Centimeters of water Integer::1 Decimal Place Value
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A unit of pressure defined by a column of water with a height of one centimeter, frequently used to measure central venous pressure, intracranial pressure, and for pressures during mechanical ventilation.:A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::1:An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A unit of pressure defined by a column of water with a height of one centimeter, frequently used to measure central venous pressure, intracranial pressure, and for pressures during mechanical ventilation.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
